thread.title: Phillips 66 Unveils Lower Spending Plan for 2016, Boosts Buybacks
thread.title_full: Phillips 66 Unveils Lower Spending Plan for 2016, Boosts Buybacks - WSJ

author: Lisa Beilfuss
title: Phillips 66 Unveils Lower Spending Plan for 2016, Boosts Buybacks
text:
Phillips 66 said Monday that it has set its 2016 capital budget at $3.6 billion, down from $4.6 billion last year, and boosted its stock-buyback plan by $2 billion.
The Houston-based company said the budget, excluding Phillips 66 Partnersâ€™s capital spending, is focused on its midstream business lines. The company plans to invest $2 billion there, and it said it would spend $1.2 billion on its refining segment.
Phillips 66...
